name: places/ChIJQR_ebb1ZwokR5rlO-XErf8c
formattedAddress: 108 W 15th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 108 W 15th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: I've been living at Stonehenge Gardens for almost a year now, and absolutely love it!  The building and grounds are kept very nice and clean, and the Super is always there to lend an extra hand when needed!  I often run into people on the streets looking in the front gate, and asking me if it's a garden, not realizing it's an apartment building.  The nicely landscaped front entrance offers privacy which is much needed in such a big, busy city.  I can't say enough great things about living at Stonehenge, and would recommend it to anyone!

originalText.text: Stonehenge Gardens was our home in NYC for 6 years. It's a wonderful spot, central to everything and you have your own little oasis inside the gates. Everyone from Piotr, our Super to Sheena, the Senior Leasing Manager has been so wonderful.

text.text: Stonehenge Gardens was our home in NYC for 6 years. It's a wonderful spot, central to everything and you have your own little oasis inside the gates. Everyone from Piotr, our Super to Sheena, the Senior Leasing Manager has been so wonderful.

originalText.text:
BETTER WATCH OUT WITH THE WATER IN THIS BUILDING. Its always ðŸŸ¢GREENðŸŸ¢.

I didn't know until I filled my bath full.
It was very hard to tell when I use them for food or to shower but seriously try bath. You'll see what I mean. I told super multiple times about the green water and all I got is keep the water running until I see clear water and It's green because no one is using the water.. this is a joke right? No matter how long you run the water, everytime when you need to use them, it will always be green.

So to survive this heavy metal water, I ordered water filter from Amazon, not Brita (it doesn't help much) but one with actual white filter inside the tube. This white filter turned brown with one use and I see them completely dark brown almost black just in a week.

originalText.text:
I previously posted a review here that appears to have been removed. I am a resident here and have to advise against living in this building at all costs. The heating provided is such a joke that from day to day the temperature inside our apartment varies from 66 to 95 and repeated discussions with the super have fallen upon deaf ears.
UPDATE: I moved out of this building in April and upon asking for our deposit back Stonhenge ghosted us. Finally after months and months of chasing, we got our security deposit back THREE MONTHS LATER. Absolutely apalling.

originalText.text: Great building and amazing location. Sheena and the team were very helpful in ensuring a smooth and seemless rental experience. Piotr is always available and extremely helpful, regardless of the situation.
